utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How may I help you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi, umm, so I've had a sore throat for the past three days and it doesn't seem to be getting any better, and I've also had a fever. So, I thought I should get it checked out by you.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, for sure. So you said that the sore throat started three days ago. Has it been getting any better or any worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Neither, it's been the same.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, is it painful to swallow food or liquids?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's painful to swallow solids, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uh, and how is your, umm, have you had any voice changes like a hot potato voice or sound like muffled or any voice changes at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not really. No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you noticed any like neck swelling?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And how about your appetite? Has that changed?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, I'm still hungry, I just don't eat as much 'cause my throat is sore.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Right, OK, that makes sense. And so you mentioned that you also had a fever. When did that start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: That started two days ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK and did, did you check it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It was 38.8.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Alright, so yeah, certainly a fever. OK, and have you had any, uh, like any runny nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I've noticed.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about any red eyes or itchy eyes or eye discharge?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about any loss or changes to your sense of smell or taste?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Have you had any any headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no headaches, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. How about any cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No coughing, OK. And how about any shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had any wheezing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No chest pain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any fainting or dizziness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any heart palpitations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And so you don't you haven't had any cough, but have you had any instances of bringing up any sputum or or any blood?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you had any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you had any abdominal pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: You had any diarrhea or, or constipation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. How about any urinary problems?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see, OK. And any skin changes or rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, any muscle aches or body pains?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And any, and how's your energy been? Have you had fatigue?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I have been, yeah, I've been tired.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you had any, have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I have type one diabetes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and uh, insulin wise, do you use a pump or is it like, how do you manage diabetes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I use an insulin pump, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, excellent, and do you see an endocrinologist for that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Well that's good and have you had any complications or have things been stable?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Things have been pretty stable. I had, when I was younger, I had a few episodes of like hypoglycemia. But now things are pretty stable.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and you can recognize those signs like feeling jittery and sweaty might, maybe a little anxious when that comes on?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, I'm an expert now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, that's great that you can recognize that those signs. It's important. And have you had any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, no allergies.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any, and all your immunizations up to date?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Ah, yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm, and any hospitalizations or surgeries before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uh, and uh currently, are you in, in school or working?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'm in school. I'm in Grade 10 and we're doing half days now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Err, half days like in person?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah half in person and half online.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Have you been around anybody who's been sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no one at schools been sick actually.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm and have you traveled anywhere?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Ah, nope, not not since COVID.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I see an are you ah, who are you living with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I live with both my parents and three of my siblings.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and anybody at home have any sore throat or cough, or or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, so my younger sister had a sore throat like a week back, but that's all she had. She never had a fever and her sore throat went away in like 2 days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uh, OK and does she need any treatment?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uh, and uh, and I I know people around your age might experiment with drugs or alcohol. Have you used anything like that or your friends?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh no, no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And do you smoke cigarettes or have you tried?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, I tried once but I don't ever do it regularly.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And uh, and do you smoke cannabis or use cannabis products?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no, I never have tried.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And and is there a family history of any heart or or lung conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, I know my grandfather had lung cancer, but he used to smoke.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I see. How old was he? Roughly?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, he was in his late 60s.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I'm sorry to hear that, and thank you and oh sorry, I forgot to ask her are you currently sexually active?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Have you been sexually active before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so umm, OK. Uhm, so that was all the questions that, uhm that, that I wanted to ask, was there anything else that you wanted to umm, mention today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, I don't think so. Is it, when you asked me if my neck was swollen, my necks not swollen but I feel like inside the back of my throat, my tonsils feel a little bit swollen.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you looked? Does it look like you have like redness in the back of your, back of your mouth?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it looks pretty red and angry.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and it's sore?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so it's just to kind of summarize, this happens like this sometimes you been having so the sore throat, like the redness and swelling of the tonsils in the back of your mouth, as well as a fever and being pretty tired over these last few days.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, yeah. Um alright, so it's sounding like most likely this would be strep throat or, or Group A strep pharyngitis with, because you have no cough, and with a high fever and swelling that you've been redness that you notice in the back of your mouth. And so we'll do a rapid strep antigen test and it will require just a throat swab. To see, to to detect for that, however with a, uh, umm, yeah, I guess that's it. That's what I yeah, well, we'll start with with that now and it could potentially be something like uhm, a viral illness, but that's lower on the on the differential then the bacterial infection is right now. And because of COVID it will be, we'll do a swab as well because people can get fever and sore throat with with COVID as well.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Ok.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So just to make sure that we're being comprehensive.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK. That sounds good. Thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
